{"id":1216726263,"question_id":4,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"8 months, 1 week","timestamp":1711656846,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"28 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1216726263/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"94.7 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    double findMedianSortedArrays(vector<int>& nums1, vector<int>& nums2) {\n        int n=0, m=0;\n        int l1=(int)nums1.size(), l2=(int)nums2.size();\n\n        nums1.push_back(INT_MAX);\n        nums2.push_back(INT_MAX);\n\n        int i = 0, lastnum = -1;\n        while(n <= l1 and m <= l2) {\n            if (n + m == (l1 + l2) / 2) {\n                if ((l1+l2) % 2 == 1) {\n                    return min(nums1[n], nums2[m]);\n                } else {\n                    return (min(nums1[n], nums2[m]) + lastnum)*1.0 / 2;\n                }\n            }\n            if (nums1[n] < nums2[m]) lastnum = nums1[n], n++;\n            else lastnum = nums2[m], m++;\n            \n        }\n        return -1;\n    }\n};\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
